I would have liked to have watched Tim's broadcast live but the launch was in the early hours of the morning UK time and I couldn't really stay up. I'll definitely tune into the next live coverage he does.

Regarding this launch, the best video coverage was from ordinary people many miles away. I thought the official footage was a bit uninspiring.
SpaceX is smart launching at that time because it gets people in LA talking about them.
You should put the chat on the livestream to make it easier to follow for poor people like me who can’t catch it live. You can use StreamLabs. Keep up the great work.

Two things. When answering tax payer money question you neglected the obvious: Vandenberg was not available for nothing. I am sure they were charged a healthy fee for use of the facility. One of the benefits of private spacefaring. Also, Falcon Heavy not going to Mars, but Mars’ orbit.

Do you think they might have landed the first stage secretly on the ship directly on the launch-clamps of "The Roomba"? That would not need any legs and they have had enough fuel left on the other Iridium launches. And they did bring the booster down-ish with entry-burn and all....

1:28hour...solid oxygen...cool.

Dude - you're doing sound wrong. Get a mic as close to your mouth as possible - it sounds awful all the way through - and makes you look like an amateur. This is the first mistake most people make. The mic doesn't have to be expensive - $5-100 will sound better than what you're using now *if its close to your mouth*.
